iati-activity.title: Systematic review and research mapping programme South Asia
iati-activity.description: To improve the quality of policy and effectiveness of development programmes by making high quality evidence more accessible to decision-makers in South Asia. By collating all available evidence and assessing its quality and relevance, systematic reviews offer a more efficient way to inform DFID and government programme decision-makers. The expected outcome is that there is (a) greater availability and use of high quality evidence among decision-makers and that more researchers in South Asia are able to prepare systematic reviews, and (b) improved understanding and use of national research capacity in South Asia.

iati-activity.title: Prevent trafficking of women and girls from South Asia in the domestic and garment sectors.
iati-activity.description: To deliver a programme that helps prevent 100,000 women and girls from India, Bangladesh and Nepal from being trafficked through economic, social, and legal empowerment by 2017. This programme will help deliver DFIDs Strategic Vision for Girls and Women in two priority areas - Preventing Violence against Women and Girls; and increasing Direct Assets for Girls and Women through better wages, working conditions and remittances from safe labour migration.
